revision:
1. 3D shapes are those shapes which have 3 dimensions such as length, breadth and height.
  2. They occupy some space. Eg: cube (box), cylinder (jar), sphere (ball) etc. They have different views from different positions.
  3. Types of polyhedrons:
    • Convex polyhedron
    • Regular polyhedra or platonic solids
  4. It is a polyhedron where all the diagonals lie inside of the polyhedron, if they lie outside, it is a non convex polyhedron. Its faces are congruent regular polygons and the same number of faces meet at each vertex.
